name: salix-integra-hakuro-nishiki
country-or-region-of-origin: China, Japan, Korea and southeastern Siberia
wildlife-value: Members of the Salix genus support the following specialized bees: Andrena (Parandrena) andrenoides, Andrena (Thysandrena) bisalicis, Andrena (Tylandrena) erythrogaster, Andrena (Andrena) frigida, Andrena (Micrandrena) illinoiensis, Andrena (Andrena) macoupinensis, Andrena (Trachandrena) mariae, Andrena (Parandrena) nida, Andrena (Micrandrena) nigrae, Andrena (Micrandrena) salictaria, Andrena (Parandrena) wellesleyana.
light: Full sun (6 or more hours of direct sunlight a day)
Partial Shade (Direct sunlight only part of the day, 2-6 hours)
flower-description: Non-showy yellowish flowers in small catkins (to 1” long) in spring (April-May). Grown for foliage.
leaf-description: Green, white, pink new growth, variegation on slender, delicate branches
stem-description: Stems turn red (primarily the new growth stems in Zones 4-5) in fall providing excellent winter interest. All stems turn red in warm winter climates.
